title: Khmer people
summary: Khmer people (Khmer: ជនជាតិខ្មែរ, Chônchéatĕ Khmêr  [cunciət kʰmae]) are a Southeast Asian ethnic group native to Cambodia. They comprise over 90% of Cambodia's population of 17 million.[11] They speak the Khmer language, which is part of the larger Austroasiatic-language family found in parts of Southeast Asia (including Vietnam and Laos), parts of central, eastern, and northeastern India, parts of Bangladesh in South Asia, in parts of Southern China and numerous islands in the Indian Ocean.
